name: Fractured Celebrities Multiple Choice Quiz | 15 Questions

questions.text:
This sportsman has a double A name.

Are The Rash
questions.explanation:
Arthur Ashe.

	Arthur Ashe was an American tennis player born in Virginia in 1943.  He was the first black man to win singles at the Wimbledon, US Open, and Australian Open.  In 1993, he died at the age of 49.

questions.text:
This host has a double B name.

Baa Brr Car
questions.explanation:
Bob Barker.

	Bob Barker, born in 1923, was a famous American television game show host.  From 1957 to 1975, he was the host of "Truth or Consequences".  In 1972, he began hosting "The Price is Right" until he retired in 2007.

questions.text:
This comedian has a double C name.

Churl Each Apple In
questions.explanation:
Charlie Chaplin.

	Charlie Chaplin, an English comic actor, was born in 1889.  He was famous for his films during the silent film era.  He created dozens of short slapstick films, starring in them as well as producing and directing.  He died in 1977 in Switzerland.

questions.text:
This comedian has a double D name.

Day Fed Dill Lou Wheeze
questions.explanation:
David DeLuise.

	David DeLuise is an American actor and comedian, and was born in 1971.  He is the son of Dom DeLuise, another famous American actor.  David DeLuise has been in many films and television shows, perhaps most notably as the character Jerry Russo in "Wizards of Waverly Place" (as well as any associated films).

questions.text:
This actor has a double E name.

A Meal Leo West A Fez
questions.explanation:
Emilio Estevez.

	Emilio Estevez, born in New York in 1962, is one of the famous acting sons of Martin Sheen.  He is brother to Charlie Sheen, Ramon Estevez, and Renee Estevez.  He has acted in many films, and has also directed a few as well.

questions.text:
This voice actor has a double G name.

Guild Bird God Freed
questions.explanation:
Gilbert Gottfried.

	Gilbert Gottfried, born in 1955, is an American actor, comedian, and voice actor known for his irritating voice and squinting eyes.  He is perhaps most known as the voice of Iago from "Aladdin" as well as the AFLAC Duck until 2011.

questions.text:
This aviator has a double H name.

Ha Word Hews
questions.explanation:
Howard Hughes.

	Howard Hughes was born in 1905, and died in 1976.  He was an American businessman, an aviator, and a filmmaker.  Though he did gain some fame in Hollywood, he is perhaps best known as the maker of the H-4 Hercules, best known as the Spruce Goose.

questions.text:
This singer has a double J name.

Check Gin Sun
questions.explanation:
Jack Johnson.

	Jack Johnson was born in 1975 in Hawaii, and is an American singer, songwriter, and surfer.  He is known for his folk-rock songs, including "Upside Down", a song written for the 2006 film "Curious George".

questions.text:
This country crooner has a double K name.

Chris Chris Tougher Sin
questions.explanation:
Kris Kristofferson.

	Kris Kristofferson was born in 1936, and is a country singer as well as an actor.  He is known for many songs, including "Me and Bobby McGee", and was a member of the Highwaymen.  He also acted in many films, including "Joyful Noise" in 2012 as Dolly Parton's late husband.

questions.text:
This singer has a name that is a double L.

Lea Own All Lou Us
questions.explanation:
Leona Lewis.

	Leona Louise Lewis (ooh, a triple L name) was born in 1985 in London, England. She gained fame after winning season 3 of "The X Factor" in 2006, soon becoming known the world over for hits such as "Bleeding Love" and "Better in Time".

questions.text:
This actor has a double M name.

My Come Eyers
questions.explanation:
Mike Myers & Michael Myers.

	Mike Myers was born in 1963, and is a Canadian actor. He is known as the frozen 60's spy, Austin Powers, as well as the voice of the beloved green ogre, Shrek.

questions.text:
This actor has a double N name.

Neck Knoll Tea
questions.explanation:
Nick Nolte.

	Nick Nolte, the American actor, was born in 1941. In his early career, Nolte was a model, and was on a magazine cover with Sigourney Weaver. He has starred in such films as "Prince of Tides" and "Affliction".

questions.text:
This heavy metal artist has a double O name.

Aussie Awes Born
questions.explanation:
Ozzy Osbourne.

	Ozzy Osbourne was born in England in 1948. The "Godfather of Heavy Metal" was known for his band, Black Sabbath, as well as for his... peculiar speech. He also stars in the reality show "The Osbournes".

questions.text:
This singer has a double T name.

Tea Nut Earner
questions.explanation:
Tina Turner.

	Tina Turner was born in 1939 as Anna Mae Bullock.  She is an American singer who sang "Proud Mary" and "What's Love Got to Do With It?"  Her dance become iconic, and she insured her legs for millions of dollars as well.

questions.text:
This actor has a double V name.

Fence Fawn
questions.explanation:
Vince Vaughn.

	Vince Vaughn is an American actor born in 1970.  He is also a producer, screenwriter, and comedian.  He gained much success after 1996's "Swingers".  He also had roles in "The Lost World" ("Jurassic Park"), "Wedding Crashers", and "Fred Claus".
